oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Utilization of Organic Farming for In Situ Conservation of Biodiversity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lee, Minho
Han, Eun-Jung
Park, Jong-Ho
Hong, Sung-Jun
Kang, Seong-Min
Kim, Jin-Ho
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Biodiversity and ecosystem services
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic farming is potentially useful approach for in situ conservation of biodiversity when the farming technologies are effective and economically sound. Functional rate of arthropod biodiversity as an index of biodiversity quality was assessed according to some organic farming methods, such as landscape management and using companion plants in rice and soybean fields. In this study, it is important to select effective farming technologies for in situ conservation and utilization of functional biodiversity even in organic farm.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Lee, Minho; Han, Eun-Jung; Park, Jong-Ho; Hong, Sung-Jun; Kang, Seong-Min and Kim, Jin-Ho (2014) Utilization of Organic Farming for In Situ Conservation of Biodiversity. In: Rahmann, G. and Aksoy, U. (Eds.) Building Organic Bridges, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut, Braunschweig, Germany, 3, Thuenen Report, no. 20, pp. 953-956.
